columns.text:
The problem will require us to compute the following requirements for Gilmore Inc.

1. The sustainable growth rate for the company.
2. The sustainable growth rate if you use the formula of ROE $\times$ *b* and beginning period of equity.
3. The sustainable growth rate if you use the formula of ROE $\times$ *b* and end period of equity.
4. Compare the sustainable growth rates and identify high or low and why.

.

### Let's first identify the given data in the problem.

* Equity at the beginning of the year at $145,000.00.
* Total assets for the year is $210,000.00.
* Net Income for the year was $27,000.00.
* Declared dividends for the year were $5,800.00.

## Requirement 1.

### Compute the sustainable growth rate.

The sustainable growth rate is the growth without external support and financing maintains a constant debt-equity ratio.

### Compute the ending equity.

On regular occasions, calculations of return on equity are based on ending equity. To compute the ending equity, we first deduct the dividend from the net income, and the amount will be added to the beginning equity.

The computation is as follows.


$$
\begin{array}{lrr}
\text{Beginning Equity}&&\$145,000.00\\
\text{Add:}\\
\hspace{5pt}\text{Net Income}&\$27,000.00\\
\hspace{5pt}\text{Less: Declared Dividends}&\underline{5,800.00}\\
\text{Retained Earnings}&&\underline{21,200.00}\\
\textbf{Ending Equity}&&\underline{\underline{\textbf{\$166,200.00}}}

\end{array}
$$

Therefore, the ending equity is **$166,200.00**.

### Compute the return on equity.


The return on equity measures how the company's stockholders fared during the financial year.

The formula is as follows.

$$
\begin{aligned}
\textbf{Return on Equity}&= \dfrac{\text{Net Income}}{\text{Total Equity}}\\[15pt]
&= \dfrac{\$27,000.00}{\$166,200.00}\\[15pt]

&= 0.1625 \times 100\\[15pt]

&= \boxed{\textbf{16.25\%}}

\end{aligned}
$$

Therefore, the return on equity is **16.25%**.

### Compute the retention ratio.

The retention ratio is the amount of the net income retained to the equity as a reserve fund.

The formula is as follows.
$$
\begin{aligned}
\textbf{Retention Ratio}&= \dfrac{\text{Retained Earnings}}{\text{Net Income}}\\[15pt]

&= \dfrac{\$21,200.00}{\$27,000.00}\\[15pt]

&= 07852 \times 100\\[15pt]

&=\boxed{\textbf{78.52\%}}

\end{aligned}
$$


Therefore, the retention ratio is **78.52%**.

### Compute the sustainable growth rate.

The sustainable growth rate is the growth without external support and financing maintains a constant debt-equity ratio.

$$
\begin{aligned}
\textbf{Sustainable Growth Rate}&= \dfrac{\text{ROE $\times$ b}}{\text{1 - ROE $\times$ b}}\\[15pt]
&= \dfrac{16.25\% \times 78.52\%}{1 - 16.25\% \times 78.52\%}\\[15pt]
&= \dfrac{0.1276}{1 - 0.1276}\\[15pt]
&= \dfrac{0.1276}{0.8724}\\[15pt]
&= 0.1462 \times 100\\[15pt]
&= \boxed{\textbf{14.62\%}}
\end{aligned}
$$


Therefore, the sustainable growth rate is **14.62%**.

## Requirement 2.

### Compute sustainable growth rate if you use the formula of ROE $\times$ *b* and beginning period of equity.

### Compute the ROE (return on equity) based on the beginning equity.

The return on equity will change since we use the beginning equity as the basis.


$$
\begin{aligned}
\textbf{Return on Equity}&= \dfrac{\text{Net Income}}{\text{Beginning Equity}}\\[15pt]
&= \dfrac{\$27,000.00}{\$145,000.00}\\[15pt]

&= 0.1862 \times 100\\[15pt]

&= \boxed{\textbf{18.62\%}}

\end{aligned}
$$


Therefore, the ROE based on the beginning equity is **18.62%**.

### Compute the sustainable growth rate based on the beginning equity.

If the given return on equity is based on the beginning equity, the formula in calculating will be different from the regular formula.

The formula and calculation are as follows.

$$
\begin{aligned}
\textbf{Sustainable Growth Rate}&= \text{Return on Equity} \times \text{Retention Ratio}\\[15pt]
&= 18.62\% \times 78.52\%\\[15pt]


&= 0.1462 \times 100\\[15pt]

&= \boxed{\textbf{14.62\%}}

\end{aligned}
$$


Therefore, the sustainable growth rate based on the beginning equity is **14.62%**.

## Requirement.

### Compute sustainable growth rate if you use the formula of ROE $\times$ *b* and end period of equity.

### Compute the (ROE) return on equity based on the ending equity. 

The return on equity will be the same as the standard calculation on equity. The basis of equity is ending equity.

$$
\begin{aligned}
\textbf{Return on Equity}&= \dfrac{\text{Net Income}}{\text{Total Equity}}\\[15pt]
&= \dfrac{\$27,000.00}{\$166,200.00}\\[15pt]

&= 0.1625 \times 100\\[15pt]

&= \boxed{\textbf{16.25\%}}

\end{aligned}
$$

Therefore, the return on equity is **16.25%**.

### Compute the sustainable growth rate based on the ending equity.

If the given return on equity is based on the ending equity, we will use the standard formula in calculating the sustainable growth rate.

$$
\begin{aligned}
\textbf{Sustainable Growth Rate}&= \dfrac{\text{ROE $\times$ b}}{\text{1 - ROE $\times$ b}}\\[15pt]
&= \dfrac{16.25\% \times 78.52\%}{1 - 16.25\% \times 78.52\%}\\[15pt]
&= \dfrac{0.1276}{1 - 0.1276}\\[15pt]
&= \dfrac{0.1276}{0.8724}\\[15pt]
&= 0.1462 \times 100\\[15pt]
&= \boxed{\textbf{14.62\%}}
\end{aligned}
$$


Therefore, the sustainable growth rate based on the ending equity is **14.62%**.

## Requirement 4.

### Compare the sustainable growth rates and identify high or low and why.

Here are the following sustainable growth rates using different assumptions.
|	Description	|	Value	|
|--		|--:		|
|	Standard Sustainable Growth Rate	|	14.62%	|
|	Sustainable Growth Rate based on beginning Equity	|	14.62%	|
|	Sustainable Growth Rate based on ending equity	|	14.62%	|

The sustainable growth rates will be the same for the three different assumptions. It is a matter of choosing the right formula in computing the sustainable growth rate.
In this exercise, we are to determine the sustainable growth rate of the company using the total equity, the beginning equity, and the ending equity of the company.

## Sustainable Growth Rate
\
The sustainable growth rate is referred to as the maximum rate of growth attainable by the company without the need for external equity financing and at the same time, maintaining the debt-to-equity at a constant ratio.

The sustainable growth rate is the maximum rate of growth that a company would attain which requires the firm not to increase the company equity. While the ROE is the ratio of the net income and the equity.
\
Therefore, the sustainable growth rate is directly proportional to the ROE indicating that as the ROE increases, the sustainable growth rate increases and as the ROE decreases, the sustainable growth rate decreases as well.

## Required (1)
\
Now, let us determine the sustainable growth rate using the following given:
 

<center>

|Given||
|:--|--:|
|Beginning Equity|\$145,000|
|Total Assets|\$210,000|
|Net Income|\$27,000|
|Dividends|\$5,800|

## Accounting Return on Equity
\
Accounting Return on Equity is referred to as the financial measure of the company's financial performance. The ROE is computed by dividing the net income of the company by the total equity.

## Retention Ratio
\
The retention ratio is referred to as the rate of the net income that is included in the retained earnings and is used to grow the business.

Now, let us compute the sustainable growth rate:
 
$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Sustainable Growth Rate}&=\frac{\text{ROE} \times b}{1-\text{ROE}\times b}\times 100\\[12pt]
&=\frac{0.1625\times 79\%}{1-0.1625\times 79\%}\times 100\\[12pt]
&=\frac{0.1284}{1-0.1284}\times 100\\[12pt]
&=\frac{0.1284}{0.8716}\times 100\\[12pt]
&={0.1473}\times 100\\[12pt]
&=\boxed{14.73\%}\\
\end{aligned}$$
 
**The sustainable growth rate of the company is 14.73\%.**

## Required (2)
\
Now, let us determine the sustainable growth rate using the beginning equity of the company.

## Required (3)
\
Now, let us determine the sustainable growth rate using the ending equity of the company.

Since the total equity used to determine the sustainable growth rate of the company in the first requirement is the ending equity, the rate to be arrived at using the ending equity to compute the sustainable growth rate is 14.73\% as shown in the computation in the preceding steps.

## Required (4)
\
Now, let us analyze the computed amounts for the sustainable growth rate.

The computed sustainable growth rates are as follows:
 
<center>

|Determination of the Sustainable Growth Rate|Sustainable Growth Rate|
|:--|--:|
|Using the Total Equity|14.73\%|
|Using the Beginning Equity|14.73\%|
|Using the Ending Equity|14.73\%|

Based on the table in the preceding step, the computed sustainable growth rate under the three assumptions results in the same rate of sustainable growth (the discrepancies in the values are due to the rounding off of the decimal places in the computation).
\
This is due to the fact that despite the difference in the amount of equity used in the calculation, the formulas used are modified in accordance with the assumption of the equity used to arrive at the sustainable growth rate.

textbook.authors: Bradford D. Jordan, Randolph W. Westerfield, Stephen A. Ross
textbook.title: Fundamentals of Corporate Finance
